item.title: Jagex's new venture
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

My suggestions didn’t preclude innovation. They basically make the game more about user input and less about time.
At the moment their flagship game is mostly time, very little user input.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex's new venture
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:30, topic:386380”][quote author=Niall link=topic=482135.msg3545036#msg3545036 date=1301140260]

Anyone else agree that Megan Fox really isn’t that hot?

she was hot years back but now, forehead maaaaaan

also itt transformers game will have exactly the same gameplay as runescape
[/quote]
I hope not, otherwise it’s going to be a dead end. The current style of gameplay they offer is slow paced compared to competitors; as it stands, someone leveling up a skill such as herblore might perform less than 10 actions a minute. Even in PVP, actions per minute are substantially lower than other games on the market that require a lot more skill on the player’s part.

In short, if they want to produce a successful game then they need to ditch point-and-click movement, they need to add support for keybindings, they need to drastically increase the responsiveness of the game (600ms game pulse in 2011? One guy on gamedev who was developing something said it operated at 1000Hz, or 10ms pulse), and probably the speed of the gameplay too.

They’ve got a ‘hardcore’ (well, depending on your perspective, but certainly hardcore compared to other MMOs like WoW when you consider how much more time is involved in completing a runescape character) game already, they aren’t going to sell another.
Most gamers are casual, they need to give those players a reasonable chance to at least partially compete with the hardcore gamers, even if it’s just features like WoW’s rest system.[/quote]Or they simply continue on the indie track and make something NEW and INNOVATIVE (something that’s been warranted since 2002).

Read full topic

Anyone else agree that Megan Fox really isn’t that hot?
[/quote]

she was hot years back but now, forehead maaaaaan

also itt transformers game will have exactly the same gameplay as runescape[/quote]
I hope not, otherwise it’s going to be a dead end. The current style of gameplay they offer is slow paced compared to competitors; as it stands, someone leveling up a skill such as herblore might perform less than 10 actions a minute. Even in PVP, actions per minute are substantially lower than other games on the market that require a lot more skill on the player’s part.

In short, if they want to produce a successful game then they need to ditch point-and-click movement, they need to add support for keybindings, they need to drastically increase the responsiveness of the game (600ms game pulse in 2011? One guy on gamedev who was developing something said it operated at 1000Hz, or 10ms pulse), and probably the speed of the gameplay too.

They’ve got a ‘hardcore’ (well, depending on your perspective, but certainly hardcore compared to other MMOs like WoW when you consider how much more time is involved in completing a runescape character) game already, they aren’t going to sell another.
Most gamers are casual, they need to give those players a reasonable chance to at least partially compete with the hardcore gamers, even if it’s just features like WoW’s rest system.

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If they decide to make a Transformers game, what would the play-style be? Would we be humans living with Transformers, or would we be the Transformers? If the latter, would we be able to upgrade our armour/weapons? Would those upgrades reflect on the shape of whatever car/animal/dinosaur we are? What period would it be set in?

Jagex, y u no answer
